intro: Calycogonium cubense, commonly known as the Cuban calycogonium, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds. Calycogonium cubense is often found in moist, tropical environments and is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
